page.title: 12CHALK DOWNLAND FLORA
page.content: The rock under the Downs is {chalk.}This makes a special type of soil,called an alkaline soil,on which some wild flowers grow particularly well. When you walk on the Downs you see a{magnificent landscape.}Much of the land is used for growing crops;the flowers grow on parts which are not cultivated. {Rest Harrow}can grow up to 30cm. high with tough stems. The leaves are small, serated and oval. The flowers are usually pink and their petals look like cups' handles. {Common Rock Rose}is a pale yellow flower which appears between June and September. The caterpillar of the {Brown Argus Butterfly}feeds on its leaves.
